main.name: George Y Lee
main.description: studying Computer Science and Computer Engineering.
main.bio: George is an aspiring software and web developer studying Computer Science and Computer Engineering at Brown University. He has a deep passion for great food, video games, and of course, coding. George also loves traveling and has even been to South Africa for research on rhino dehorining
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me if you're interested in hiring me, meeting me, or just chatting with me. I love meeting new people!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Brown University's open curriculum allows me to deepen my passion for Computer Science and Engineering as well as explore topics in English, Math, Chemistry, and Entrepreneurship. I keep busy by working on a variety of personal projects, attending hackathons, working on a Formula One Racing Car, and exploring the East Coast.

Throughout high school, I took 13 AP courses and was a valedictorian in a class of over 500 students. I co-founded and was Vice President of my schools robotics club, sang as a baritone for the school's Madrigals choir, and competed in Shot Put and Discus. Every month, I would volunteer at the Discovery Cube OC and teach young children the wonders of science and technology. I also conducted breast cancer research at the University of California, Irvine, and studied the effects of dehorning rhinos at Mankwe Reserve in South Africa.

Developing a community centered delivery app to bridge gaps between deliverers and shoppers. Developing with React-Native.

work.title: Steering Subsystem Lead
work.description: Learned to  machine metal using mills and lathes. Created chain guard from scratch from designing the part on Solidworks to actual fabrication with a solid piece of stock. Leading steering subsystem.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
